intro: Leutea nematoloba, commonly known as the slender leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Leutea nematoloba is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
